abstract: Levelland High School girls' basketball team is 24-2 this season largely because of sisters Elizabeth and Sujei Cera, who moved to Levelland, Tex, from Mexico in 2013, and make up Levelland's starting backcourt; sisters average 11 points a piece per game and nearly seven steals a game combined (Series: Not the Knicks).
lead_paragraph: Thanks to two sisters from Mexico, the tradition-rich Levelland High School girls’ basketball team, which has not won a Texas state title since 1997, is an up-tempo, high-scoring contender.

byline.contributor: Elena Gustines contributed reporting from New York.

snippet: Thanks to two sisters from Mexico, the tradition-rich Levelland High School girls’ basketball team, which has not won a Texas state title since 1997, is an up-tempo, high-scoring contender.

headline.main: New to U.S., Sisters Help School Return to Dominance in a Flash
headline.seo: Levelland Loboettes Have Regained Their Winning Ways in Texas
headline.print_headline: New to U.S., Sisters Help School Return to Dominance in a Flash
